method.name: selectdata
method.shortdescription: Select the data based on the given parameters. For unspecified parameters, the full data range is assumed. All data selection parameters follow the MS Selection syntax.

param.name: config
param.description:
The record (dictionary) config may be given or not. If it is not given, 
 and no specific parameter is given either, the whole MS will be selected. The record 
 may contain any data selection parameters supported by MS Selection such as:

param.name: field
param.description: Field indices or source names : example : '2,3C48'

param.name: spw
param.description: Spectral Window Indices or names : example : '1,2'

param.name: array

param.name: feed

param.name: scan

param.name: antenna

param.name: uvrange

param.name: timerange

param.name: correlation

Select the whole MS af.selectdata()
Select a portion of the MS myrecord={} myrecord['scan']='1~3' myrecord['spw']='0:1~10' af.selectdata(myrecord)

method.name: parseagentparameters
method.shortdescription: Parse the parameters for the agent (flagging mode).
method.description: The specific data selection parameters for the agent (flagging mode) are parsed. These parameters are the data selection and mode-specific parameters. See the example below:

param.name: aparams
param.description:
It takes a record (dictionary) with the specific parameters for the flagging mode. 
 The record may contain any data selection parameters supported by MS Selection, as well as 
 mode-specific parameters such as:
 
 (1) array,feed,scan,field,spw,intent,correlation,antenna,uvrange,observation 
 (2) mode (which can be: manual,clip,quack,shadow,elevation,tfcrop,extendflags,unflag or summary) 
 For flagging mode=clip, the parameters are: expression, datacolumn, clipminmax, etc. 
 See the documentation of the task flagdata for all the available parameters for each mode.
 
 (3) apply: default is true (true for flagging and false for unflagging) 
 Example:

 myrecord={}
 myrecord['mode']='clip'
 myrecord['scan']='1~3'
 myrecord['clipminmax']=[0.02,0.3]
 myrecord['apply']=True
 af.parseagentparameters(myrecord)

method.example: myrecord={} myrecord['mode']='clip' myrecord['scan']='1~3' myrecord['clipminmax']=[0.02,0.3] myrecord['apply']=True af.parseagentparameters(myrecord)

param.description: Observation Id. Example: '2~4'

param.name: ntime
param.description: Time-range to use for each chunk (in seconds or minutes). Default:

param.name: combinescans
param.description: Accumulate data across scans depending on the value of ntime. Default:

param.name: datacolumn
param.description: Data column to use for clipping. Example: 'DATA'. Default:

param.name: timecutoff
param.description: Flagging thresholds in units of deviation from the fit. Default:

param.name: freqcutoff
param.description: Flagging thresholds in units of deviation from the fit. Default:

param.name: freqfit
param.description: Fitting function for the frequency direction (poly/line). Default:

param.name: maxnpieces
param.description: Number of pieces in the polynomial-fits (for \'freqfit\' or \'timefit\' = \'poly\'). Default:

param.name: flagdimension
param.description: Dimensions along which to calculate fits (freq/time/freqtime/timefreq). Default:

param.name: usewindowstats
param.description: Calculate additional flags using sliding window statistics (none,sum,std,both). Default:

param.name: halfwin
param.description: Half-width of sliding window to use with \'usewindowstats\' (1,2,3). Default:

param.name: extendflags
param.description: Extend the flags in time, frequency and correlations. Default:

param.name: apply
param.description: Parameter to flag or unflag the data. Default:

param.name: channelavg
param.description: Average data over channels before clipping? [True/False]. Default:

param.name: chanbin
param.description: Width (bin) of input channels to average to form an output channel.

param.name: timeavg
param.description: Average data over time ranges. [True/False]. Default:

param.name: timebin
param.description: Bin width for time average. Example: '2s'

method.example:
The correlation parameter can be used with an operator for the tfcrop mode. The operator should be written only once and it will affect all the polarizations given in the string. Note that if ntime='scan' and combinescans=True, all the scans will be loaded at once, thus requesting a lot of memory depending on the available spws. The parameter combinescans should be set to True only when ntime is specified as a time-interval (not 'scan'). By default, the flags will be extended in time, if more than 50\% of the timeranges are flagged, 80\% of the channels are flagged and it will extend to other polarizations too. This is similar to running the extend mode after running tfcrop on the MS.
af.parsetfcropparameters(spw='9', ntime=10.0, combinescans=True, correlation='ABS_XX,XY', extendflags=True)
